Module it.polimi.ingsw
Package it.polimi.ingsw.model

Class Player

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.model.Player
public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
The class to manage a player, saving his username, his workers' color and his chosen divinity; the class also contains the list of his workers and a set of possible actions changing during the game.

It is remarkable that we unanimously decided that different players can have the same divinity

    • Player

      public Player​(java.lang.String username, Color color)
      Constructor of the player, given his username and chosen a Color. All his other attributes are instantiated and set to null
      Parameters:
      username - chosen by the user
      color - assigned by the match

    • getPossibleActions

      public java.util.ArrayList<Action> getPossibleActions()
      List of actions a player can choose from
      Returns:
      Returns a HashSet containing the player's next possible actions, i.e. Action.MOVE, Action.BUILD, Action.BUILDDOME and Action.END

    • getColor

      public Color getColor()

    • move

      public boolean move​(Board board, Worker selectedWorker, Tile selectedTile)
      Moves one worker on a tile through the invocation of move on the player's divinity in order to follow the pattern Decorator.

      In addition it manages the next possible actions: if the move is possible, in first place, it clears the list from actions in order to respect the game logic; then it adds the possibility to build as in the basic Santorini's rules and it adds other possible actions deriving from a divinity's effects

      Parameters:
      board - game's board
      selectedWorker - worker performing the action
      selectedTile - tile where to perform the action
      Returns:
      true whether the move was successful

    • build

      public boolean build​(Board board, Worker selectedWorker, Tile selectedTile)
      Builds with a worker on a tile through the invocation of build on the player's divinity in order to follow the pattern Decorator.

      In addition, it manages the next possible actions: if the build is possible, in first place, it clears the list from actions in order to respect the game logic; then it adds other possible actions deriving from a divinity's effects

      Parameters:
      board - game's board
      selectedWorker - worker performing the action
      selectedTile - tile where to perform the action
      Returns:
      true whether the build was successful

    • startOfTurn

      public void startOfTurn()
      Method called at the start of each turn to setup a player's possible actions, adding Action.MOVE and eventual others resulting from a divinity's properties

    • getModelUpdates

      public java.util.List<ModelUpdate> getModelUpdates()
      List of Tiles that are to be sent to other players to inform them of changes on the board
      Returns:
      List of ModelUpdate
